results.title: Hurricane Roslyn to Hit Mexico as a Major Storm
results.abstract: Roslyn became a Category 4 hurricane on Saturday. Forecasters warned it could bring coastal flooding and dangerous winds to cities along the Pacific Coast.

media.caption: Roslyn is a Category 4 hurricane, forecast to reach the coast of west-central Mexico on Sunday.

results.adx_keywords: Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Recalls and Bans of Products;Ethylene Glycol;Food Contamination and Poisoning;Hazardous and Toxic Substances;Poisoning and Poisons;Kidneys;World Health Organization;Indonesia;Haryana (India);Gambia
results.title: Here’s What to Know About the Cough Syrup Scandal
results.abstract: Tainted syrup from India may be connected to the deaths of dozens of children in Gambia, officials said. Indonesia banned cough syrup sales, though the link there is unclear.

media.caption: A notice at a pharmacy in Jakarta, Indonesia, on Thursday announcing that the sale of medicinal syrup had been halted.

results.adx_keywords: Student Loans;United States Politics and Government;Decisions and Verdicts;Appeals Courts (US);Biden, Joseph R Jr
results.byline: By Stacy Cowley and Alan Rappeport
results.title: Appeals Court Temporarily Halts Biden’s Student Debt Cancellation
results.abstract: A federal appeals court on Friday temporarily halted President Biden’s student debt relief plan, preventing the government from moving forward with the debt cancellation it had said could start as early as next week.

media.caption: President Joe Biden speaking about student loan forgiveness at Delaware State University on Friday in Dover.
media.copyright: Al Drago for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Archives and Records;Executive Privilege, Doctrine of;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Cannon, Aileen M;Dearie, Raymond J;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department;National Archives and Records Administration
results.title: Trump Claims He Owns White House Pardon and Immigration Policy Records
results.abstract: A letter to the special master overseeing a review of files seized from Mar-a-Lago has opened a window on disputes over an initial batch.

media.caption: The Justice Department is looking into whether former President Donald J. Trump unlawfully kept classified records at his estate and obstructed the government’s repeated efforts to retrieve them.
media.copyright: Rebecca Noble for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Sexual Harassment;Gynecology and Gynecologists;Sex Crimes;Decisions and Verdicts;Heaps, James;Gascon, George;Anderson, Robert E (1928-2008);Tyndall, George;University of California, Los Angeles;University of California;Los Angeles County (Calif)
results.title: Former U.C.L.A. Gynecologist Is Convicted of Sexually Abusing Patients
results.abstract: Dr. James Heaps faces up to 21 years in prison after he was convicted of five criminal counts, prosecutors said.

media.caption: Dr. James Heaps, a former U.C.L.A. gynecologist, with his lawyer, Tracy Green, in Los Angeles Superior Court in 2019, when he was initially charged.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Frauds and Swindling;Ex-Convicts;DeSantis, Ron;Paxton, Ken;Rogers, Hervis Earl;Republican Party;American Civil Liberties Union;Florida;Texas
results.title: G.O.P. Voter Fraud Crackdowns Falter as Charges Are Dropped in Florida and Texas
results.abstract: One man who had his charges dismissed was among a group of former felons who were rounded up in August under orders from Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida has made the pursuit of voter fraud a centerpiece of his tenure as governor.

results.adx_keywords: 401(k), 403(b) and 457 Plans;Pensions and Retirement Plans;Labor and Jobs;Savings;Retirement;Internal Revenue Service
results.title: 401(k) Contribution Limits Are Taking a Big Jump for 2023
results.abstract: The I.R.S. announced one of its largest increases in decades to caps on retirement contributions, allowing workers with access to the plans to save more.

media.caption: The Internal Revenue Service will raise the limit on what Americans can contribute to tax-advantaged retirement accounts next year by nearly 10 percent.
media.copyright: Karsten Moran for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Subpoenas;Midterm Elections (2022);Executive Privilege, Doctrine of;United States Politics and Government;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Trump, Donald J;House Committee on the Judiciary;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.byline: By Charlie Savage and Alan Feuer
results.title: Trump Could Harness Unresolved Legal Issues to Resist Jan. 6 Panel’s Subpoena
results.abstract: If the ex-president turns down the drama of testifying, his legal team could mount several constitutional and procedural arguments in court.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump’s legal team could also invoke executive privilege in an attempt to ward off the subpoena.
media.copyright: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Fatalities);Traffic Accidents and Safety;Diplomatic Immunity;Suits and Litigation (Civil);United States International Relations;Drunken and Reckless Driving;Dunn, Harry (d 2019);Sacoolas, Anne;State Department;Great Britain
results.title: American Woman Pleads Guilty in Death of British Teenager
results.abstract: Anne Sacoolas pleaded guilty on Thursday to causing the death of Harry Dunn, a 19-year-old British motorcyclist, in 2019, when she was a State Department employee in England.

media.caption: Members of Harry Dunn’s family arriving for a court hearing in London on Thursday. An American, Anne Sacoolas, pleaded guilty to causing Mr. Dunn’s death.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Quarantine (Life and Culture);Anxiety and Stress;Therapy and Rehabilitation;Youth;Research;Florida State University;University of Southern California;United States
results.title: Did the Pandemic Change Your Personality? Possibly.
results.abstract: For more than two years, Covid disrupted social rituals and rites of passage. Now a recent study suggests we have become less extroverted, creative, agreeable and conscientious. The declines in some traits were sharper among young people.

media.caption: Lucy Nguyen participates in a group scream at the Zionsville Youth Soccer Fields in Whitestown, Indiana.
media.copyright: Kaiti Sullivan for The New York Times

results.title: A New Procedure Could Expand Reproductive Choices for Transgender Women
results.abstract: Retrieving viable sperm from men with low fertility and from people who have used estrogen therapy for years has been a challenge, doctors say. A new, less invasive technique has promise.

media.caption: Chaya Rothschild, an andrologist at Maze Health in Manhattan, extracted sperm from an ejaculate sample in a process called extended sperm search and microfreeze.
media.copyright: Jackie Molloy for The New York Times

results.title: Zinc? Honey? Ginger? What Actually Helps When You Have a Cold or the Flu?
results.abstract: Here’s what we know about some of the most popular remedies that show at least a little promise.

results.title: She’s Inheriting Millions. She Wants Her Wealth Taxed Away.
results.abstract: Marlene Engelhorn, 30, heir to a fortune, isn’t interested in philanthropy, believing it only perpetuates existing power dynamics. She’s calling for structural change to how the ultrarich are taxed.
org_facet: Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy

media.caption: “The dream scenario is I get taxed,” said Ms. Engelhorn, the co-founder of a group called Tax Me Now.
media.copyright: Mashid Mohadjerin for The New York Times

results.byline: By Julian E. Barnes and John Ismay
results.title: Russian errors prompted the deployment of Iranian drone personnel to Ukraine, a U.S. official says.
results.abstract: John Kirby, a National Security Council official, also warned that Russia may try to buy advanced missiles from Iran.

media.caption: A drone believed to be an Iranian Shahed-136, which explodes on impact, nearing a target in Kyiv, Ukraine, on Monday.

results.byline: By Kate Conger, Ryan Mac and Lauren Hirsch
results.title: Twitter Tries Calming Employees as Deal With Elon Musk Looms
results.abstract: With Mr. Musk’s $44 billion deal to buy Twitter set to close no later than Oct. 28, the company is trying to reassure workers about their employment and compensation.

media.caption: Twitter’s headquarters in San Francisco. For months, the company’s 7,500 employees have worried how Elon Musk may change the service.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.title: Berlusconi, Caught on Tape Gushing Over Putin, Heightens Anxiety About Italy
results.abstract: Silvio Berlusconi, the former Italian leader and linchpin of the incoming right-wing government, blames Ukraine’s president for pushing President Vladimir V. Putin to invade.

results.title: Liz Truss is eligible for a taxpayer-funded allowance of $129,000 a year for life.
results.abstract: The departing British leader would be the sixth prime minister to receive the reimbursement for her expenses after leaving office.

media.caption: Prime Minister Liz Truss is eligible for the Public Duty Costs Allowance, a reimbursement of expenses incurred after she leaves office.
